speaker: Gabrielle
content: You can't order me around like I am a child. No, no. I'm not going.
mark: order around 指挥

speaker: Carlos
content: It's business. Tanaka expects everyone to bring their wives.
mark: expect sb to do sth  期望某人做某事

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Every time I'm around that man, he tries to grab my ass.
mark: be around sb 在某人身边；在某人周围；
grab v. 攫取，抓住；

speaker: Carlos
content: I made over $200,000 doing business with him last year. If he wants to grab your ass, you let him.
mark: do business with 与……做生意
200,000 two hundred thousand
make money doing sth 通过做某事赚钱。 doing sth 是现在分词短作方式状语，用来表示赚钱的方式。

speaker: Carlos
content: John!

speaker: John
content: Mr. Solis, you scared me.

speaker: Carlos
content: Why is that bush still there? You were supposed to dig it up last week.
mark: bush 灌木，灌木丛；
be supposed to 被期望做某事;应该做某事;被允许做某事
dig up 挖掘，发掘

speaker: John
content: I didn't have time last week.

speaker: Carlos
content: I don't want to hear your excuses. Just take care of it.
mark: excuses 借口，理由 原谅；为……辩解

speaker: Gabrielle
content: I really hate the way you talk to me.

speaker: Carlos
content: And I really hate that I spent $15,000 on your diamond necklace that you couldn’t live without.
mark: spend + 时间/金钱 + on + 事物/活动 表示在某事物或某项活动上花费了多少时间或者金钱。spend...in doing sth 强调花费时间或金钱去做某件事的这个行为过程
diamond 钻石
couldn’t live without 没有…… 就无法生活

speaker: Carlos
content: But I'm learning to deal with it. So, can I tell Tanaka we'll be there tomorrow night?

speaker: Gabrielle
content: John, we have bandages, top shelf in the kitchen.
mark: bandage 绷带
top shelf 顶级货架top shelf in the kitchen 厨房的顶层架子

speaker: John
content: Thanks, Mrs. Solis.

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Fine, I'll go. But I'm keeping my back pressed against the wall the entire time.
mark: press against 紧贴，压在……上 对抗，与……竞争
against the wall 靠着墙；倚着墙 / 处于困境；走投无路
keep + 宾语 + 宾语补足语: 使…… 保持（某种状态）pressed 过去分词作宾语补足语，用于补充说明宾语 “my back” 所处的状态。过去分词作宾语补足语常用来表示被动或完成的意义，在这里后背是被外力（自身的行为或者其他客观因素等）压在墙上的，所以用过去分词形式很合适。
the entire time 整个期间；自始至终 == all the time

speaker: Carlos
content: See, now this is what a marriage is all about. Compromise.
mark: all about 关于一切
This is what ... is all about 这就是…… 的全部内涵；这就是…… 的意义所在；这就是…… 的关键之处
Compromise 折中，妥协；

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Is your finger OK?

speaker: John
content: Yeah, it's just a small cut.

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Let me see. Mm.

speaker: John
content: You know, Mrs. Solis, I really like it when we hook up, but you know, I gotta get my work done and I can't afford to lose this job.
mark: hook up 连接 搭讪 提供帮助 hook 钩住，挂住
gotta == got to 必须，不得不
get sth done 使某事被做；让某事得以完成
afford 买得起；有（时间）做某事；承担得起；

speaker: Gabrielle
content: This table was hand-carved. Carlos had it imported from Italy. It cost him $23,000.
mark: hand-carved 手工雕刻的
cost → cost → cost 花费
have sth imported from somewhere 让某物从某地进口；使某物从某地被进口

speaker: John
content: You want to do it on the table this time?

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Absolutely.
